alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Carroll; Cheshire; Grafton; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Strafford; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 12:08PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Belknap, Merrimack, Strafford and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Carroll and Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Leaf debris will increase risks of flooding due to blocked drains. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated moderate to occasionally heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manchester, Nashua, Concord, Merrimack, Laconia, Franklin, Jaffrey, Henniker, and New London.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Carroll; Cheshire; Grafton; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Strafford; Sullivan
